content.rendered:
Today is National Cuban Sandwich Day. It is observed annually on August 23. Apparently, started as “fake news,” National Cuban Sandwich Day later became a real holiday, celebrating the Cuban sandwich, which was first made some time around 1870 or 1880. It is a traditional sandwich of Cuba and made its way to the the US by way of southern Florida.

Though there are many variations, the traditional Cuban sandwich is made using Cuban bread, ham or pork, cheese and pickles. The bread is coated with a thin layer of oil and it hot pressed.

There are numerous recipes online, if you want to make your own, of you can see if a local sandwich shop makes them. The sandwiches themselves range from simple to gourmet.

Today is also Buttered Corn Day, which is also observed each year on August 23. If you have corn on the cob or can get some, after cooking it, or perhaps as part of the cooking process, make sure to add butter. Maybe you can have some corn with your Cuban sandwich.

Finally, today is National Sponge Cake Day. Sponge cake can be served alone or with toppings. You may be able to purchase some from a local bakery or you can find a recipe online. Either way, it would make an excellent dessert.
